title.narrative: Improved protection mechanism in communities of Area E1 through the work of EAPPI and Bimkom

description.narrative: The project will focus on monitoring and documentation of IHL and IHRL violations in E1 areas of the West Bank. The documentation of the violations will be conducted by both EAPPI through their volunteers present in the field on a regular basis and through Bimkom who will focus on violations regarding planning of the targeted communities. The documentations and reporting of these violations from both parties will be used to provide protection tools and mechanisms to these vulnerable communities and increase their resilience. The joint cooperation between the two protection actors and DCA will contribute to a comprehensive and effective response in the targeted areas to improve their protection and thus their resilience.EAPPI has established proven strategies, the combination of protective presence, monitoring, documenting and referral of needs to increase awareness about IHL and IHRL to the local and the international communities and advocate upholding these laws. Bimkom interventions have succeeded in the past in freezing or stopping demolitions and enforced relocation through a variety of planning, legal and advocacy actions .Additionally, this project will monitor the situation of communities which, according to Bimkom’s preliminary research, are affected by some 100 actual demolitions in the past decade, and upward of 600 demolition orders that are currently hanging over the families. The response will ensure that residents and their supporters have full knowledge of the exact legal status of their buildings, understand the implications of the situation, and are presented with possible avenues of action to prevent demolition and displacement. EAPPI defines violations of IHL and HRL as incidents. Their documentation focusses on 1) Access / movement restrictions and attacks of specifically protected structures, 2) violations of IHL and HRL leading to displacement and 3) violence as such. EAPPI refers mainly to the following International human rights instruments: the Hague Regulations, Customary IHL rules, the Fourth Geneva Convention, the Convention on the Rights of the Child and the Universal Declaration of Human Rights.EAPPI also documents incidents with less established response mechanisms (i.e. evacuations for military training, injuries by UXOs, child detention) and share this reports with a list of organizations for their response. EAPPI documents violations of IHL and HRL and then shares them via a database with other organizations. EAPPI will enlarge this list of organizations it shares incidents reports with by writing to all PC members, asking them for contacts and in which type of violations they are interested in. Then, whenever an incident report is submitted, the field officers of EAPPI will forward the incident report to respective organizations. While Bimkom will be focusing on planning violation incidents in the targeted areas to complement EAPPI work and ensure effective protection response.
